12434.content:
Ruby Summers and Azul de le Mar had believed, with the talk on the train about the pounds they gained over the break since last year, and the impromptu eating contest at the welcoming feast, that Phineas would pick up on their genuine enthusiasm for gaining weight, which they knew as his fetish. That they were open to turning their friendship into something more.

Unfortunately, the morning after the eve of the new term did little to reciprocate the plans the two girls had to declare shared love towards Phineas. Azul had gone to breakfast with a new outfit, having eyed her wardrobe to find which clothes had the most give, settling for a silky soft pink blouse and taunt silvery skirt, a contrast to her unusual shade of skin. The skirt clung to her generous curves, leaving her cherubic buttocks on display in a tantalizing fashion.

Ruby did not have as many clothes as her friend's lavish wardrobe, although she had a patterned vest and work slacks that would be suitable for their classes. More importantly, a bit painfully, the results of her victory at last night's eating contest still sat heavy in her stomach. It would be worth the pain, Ruby knew, if it got Phineas to reciprocate her feelings.

Thus the pair walked in tandem to a table where Phineas was sitting, a textbook opened next to his breakfast plate. Each girl positively beamed and the prospects of showing off to their friend turned potential lover.

"Good morning, Phineas!" Azul greeted, striking a pose once she reached the table. "What do you think of my outfit?" She specifically stood in side profile as she stretched, her long deep blue hair cascading the small of her back, knowing that the impressive curve of her hip and rear would be undeniable.

"You look, um, swell!" Phineas said, suddenly nervous. Having debated his friends motivations last night, he had written off their potential of meaning to gain weight. He was happy to have the two girls as friends and classmates going into their penultimate year, and would rather not risk losing them as friends even if he had imagined them getting fatter a few times before.

Still in disbelief of this change in his friends, Phineas quickly looked back to his text on the properties of magical minerals to avoid gawking.

Taken aback, Azul looked to Ruby before taking a seat, displeased that her showing off didn't have the desired reaction.

"*oof*" Ruby lowed herself into a seat gently, playing up her performance from the welcoming feast. "I'm still feeling stuffed, I ate too much last night." She rubbed her stomach for emphasis and to relieve some pressure.

"Hmm," Phineas grunted noncommittally, willing all of his effort to keep reading the classification of metallic alloys on the page of his textbook.

"I guess that's what you get for overeating," Azul teased jokingly, although there was no malice among the conspirators to jointly sway Phineas Fortescue's heart. "I may have lost last night but I'm feeling rather famished this morning. As you would say, Ruby, having a hearty breakfast?"

Phineas felt the sweat form on the back of his neck over the sounds of Azul loading up her plate with each type of food the breakfast table had to offer, as his eyes bored into the page he had not turned in minutes.

"Now that's hardly fair!" Ruby said, making her own effort to build a breakfast plate even if her stomach complained about being full. "You have such form and grace, Azul, and those good genetics that I'm sure anything you eat only settles in your lower half tastefully."

"Guilty as charged," the de la Mar daughter grinned.

"Meanwhile, I'm so stoutly built that everything just settles in the middle." Ruby was looking intently at Phineas now, trying to catch his eye, further kneading her taunt belly at the risk of having to belch again. "I'd hardly be able to make it to my Practical Enchantments course."

Phineas, ready to explode internally and getting hard just at the odd recognition of was was said, suddenly bolted from his seat needing to find a cool spot to think before he embarrassed himself. "Well, sorry to run, Ruby, Azul, see you all in Advanced Alchemy?"

He rushed out of there carrying his books low to block a stiffie, leaving the girls to bemoan his obliviousness.

"How could he not react to anything?" Azul sighed, forking her plate of eggs, sausage, toast and hash and eating in big bites out of frustration.

"Finny is hopeless when he gets stuck in his own head," Ruby said glumly, familiar with how Phineas exercised care to make sure his lustful looks towards the chunky females at the Citadel were hidden. "Just teasing him with the talk isn't working, we'll have to hit him over the head with it."

"Indeed," Azul said after swallowing some grapefruit juice from a goblet. "What classes to we all share this term? He'll have to notice eventually."

Ruby and Azul spent the rest of the breakfast topping off as they examined their schedules, plotting new ways to get Phineas to see the truth of their efforts.

* * * *


The next phase of their plan took place in Advanced Alchemy in second period. Ruby and Azul deliberately directed Phineas towards a work station on the side of the classroom, next to a wall of cabinets and shelves stocked with materials the students used for alchemical coursework.

"Remember how we aced Intermediate Alchemy last year together?" Ruby beamed. "We're unstoppable team because we know each other so well."

"Quite so," Azul continued, as the class broke out into groups for their first assignment. Phineas was practically pinned between the two beauties as they took seat on either side of him.

Azul looked at their syllabus. "Now let's begin: we'll first need a copy of Restricted Processes For Improved Alchemical Redistribution on the top shelf."

"I'll get it!" Ruby loudly announced. The choice of student for the task was completely impractical. Shorter than the average, other students could easily reach the shelf where the texts for their grade of studies were kept by Ruby ended up falling short. She stretched and stretched with her arm, making a show of it, her plumped up midriff becoming bare as her clothes shifted, unable to cover her increased girth.

Phineas was confused. "Shouldn't I help you--?"

"Got it!" Ruby announced, having worked the book off the high shelf with her fingers. She was breathing heavily, winking at Phineas as her belly grew out and in with each breath, having yet to tug down her vest as she took her seat.

"And for the transmutation will need a block of marble and a lead plate, I can get that," Azul said. Sitting on the far side away from the supply cabinet, her getting up and brushing past Phineas and Ruby made even less sense than Ruby being tasked with the top shelf. The ingredients were in the bottom cabinet, causing Azul to stoop low to retrieve them.

The act was a deliberately ploy to emphasize her expanded rear, as the twin cheeks of her lovely rounded bum tested the limits of her skirt. She risked bumping her butt into the faces of her friends. The other downside to reaching for the heavy base materials was that Azul, having a pampered life, didn't have as strong of muscle tone as Ruby's stout build. She struggled to lift the marble block and lead plate together, butt flexing with each failed attempt to right herself

"Maybe just one at a time?" Phineas suggested, his brain currently at critical confusion as to what had come over Azul and Ruby's actions.

"Of course," Azul breathed heavily, her dusky skin hiding the beads of sweat that had formed on her face from the exertion.

Again, she brushed past Ruby and Phineas to return to her seat, the two girls nearly squishing Phineas they were sitting so close. The rambunctious display of exhibitionism had failed to capture Phineas's attention again, as he hurried himself in the alchemy assignment after the materials were gathered.

The rest of the day proved fruitless. From trying to have Phineas get a feel for their bodies in a midday Dueling course, to playing up how hungry the schooling made them at lunch, to trying to explain what love Phineas had in his future during a Divination Symposium, nothing got through Phineas' thick skull that not only did his best friends have feelings for him, they also shared in his kink. By supper the girls were desperate.

"Should we just tell him?" Ruby said after Phineas had failed to show for the evening meal. "I mean, privately, of course. He's too nervous in public displays."

Azul drummed her well manicured fingers on the table. "If he's panicking at our teases, I don't know if he could take an outright declaration of love. Even if jointly presented. He'll probably not want to hurt either of our feelings." Phineas' lack for social graces and lack of self esteem were becoming hindrances for the girls' efforts. It would be torture keeping this up for an entire semester if Phineas never got the hint.

"I think we'll have to step up our game," Azul suggested.

124341.content:
Ruby took some time to compose her thoughts before she said, "I think we need to give him some more time."

Azul raised a skeptical eyebrow at her friend, and gestured with her hand to continue.

"It's just... I think we both know that Finny doesn't like talking about himself. I think he's been denying what he really wants for so long that he's not sure how to talk about it. And I think it's important that he needs to figure out how to do that," Ruby said. "I don't think trying to force an answer out of him is going to be healthy for any of us."

Azul let out a frustrated sigh. "Ah, you're probably right. I guess I'm so used to having an easy solution for any problem at hand that I didn't really think there might not be one in this case. I guess we just have to keep at it. I mean, he's definitely interested. I saw his expression when you brushed up against him in Dueling this morning."

Ruby grinned and replied, "He couldn't keep his eyes off your butt in Advanced Alchemy! It's like he was in a trance!"

"It is a well-known fact that the butts of the de la Mar family have induced trances in many people. It's one of our most infamous family magics," Azul said in a faux-haughty tone. She was able to keep her serious expression for a few more minutes before it dissolved into giggles along with Ruby.

After catching her breath, Ruby said, "Maybe we should lighten up a little on the teasing, though."

"Maybe," Azul conceded. "But you know what we shouldn't lighten up on?" As she spoke, Azul cast a minor teleportation spell, transporting a just-finished cheesecake from the Citadel Kitchens to the table near the girls.

Ruby stared at the confection for a moment, before looking back at Azul. "You gotta show me how to do that."

"I guess I should," Azul responded. "Because this one's all mine!"

- - - - - - -

Phineas decided that life was going okay for now. The first day of classes back at the Citadel had been kind of weird, but afterwards Ruby and Azul seemed to go back to normal.

Well, not quite normal. While they definitely weren't doing so as much as they had on that first day back, there were instances in the day where one of them would do something... distracting. Phineas tried his best to be a gentleman, he really did! But when Azul leaned over in such a way that Phineas got an eyeful of her cleavage, or Ruby used her hips to close a door due to her arms being full, it was hard not to be distracted! The weirdest part was when he caught one or both of them noticing him staring. He expected to be told off or slapped or something, but nothing ever came of it!

And then there was the food.

Neither Azul nor Ruby had ever been the skinniest girls in his class. Even last year, they both had had eaten well, not subscribing to the diets that those students who wanted to lose weight went on. But this year, it was like they couldn't get enough. Hearty breakfasts, heavy lunches, seconds at dinnertime, and plenty of snacks to graze on when they studied, wether as a group or solo. And it was definitely starting show.

Ruby's had always had a figure that the more polite students would call "stout," and now it was beginning to round out. Her belly was acquiring more mass, though it could be hard to tell how big it naturally was sometimes due to the fact that Ruby was constantly stuffing herself. The real expansion was happening down below, with Ruby's enlarging hips, thighs, and butt giving her a pear shape. Not to say that the rest of her wasn't getting softer, but that wasn't where the main show was.

Azul, meanwhile, was widening on both top and bottom. Phineas had overheard her talking to Ruby about needed to be fitted for a bigger bra, and her bustline definitely seemed to be expanding. At the same time, her hips were also getting wider and softer, giving her more of an hourglass shape. Like Ruby, her belly was usually kept full, but it didn't seem to be expanding at the same rate the redhead's was. It wouldn't be unfair to call her downright Rubenesque these days.

Overall, Phineas was conflicted. The two of them were definitely getting fatter. They had to know, right? Except that there wasn't any of the usual complaining about gaining weight that Phineas had heard from most of his heavier classmates. In fact, they seemed... fine with it? Or were they just in denial? If they were, then it was Phineas's job as their friend to talk about it with them, wasn't it? Only, even someone with as little social grace as Phineas knew that asking a girl about her weight was not what one did. And then of course there was that more lustful part of him that wanted to see just how big his friends would get.

It was a lot to think through.

So, things continued on as they had. Phineas, Ruby, and Azul continued working together in their classes. The girls continued to flirt with the confused young man, and continued to eat themselves bigger. And Phineas continued to be confused, wondering just what he was missing. This tenuous status quo finally changed during one of the last weekends of summer, when...

13.content:
The namesake Citadel of the Citadel Prepatory Academy for Rites & Sorcery was an immense fortress hidden away from the rest of the world. It had countless halls, courtyards and rooms. Many students warned against straying too far along less traveled hallways as it was very easy to get lost. The fortress was a boarding school, of course, providing every possible amenity to its students as they spent their formative years in one of the five dormitories.

Each dormitory selected its students from each incoming year. The process was vague, with contradictory explanations. All that was known was that by the time the students got off the locomotive in time for the Welcoming Festival, they had already been assigned to their dorms. Each dormitory banded together as a family of sorts, as they would compete with each other throughout the year in marks, sports and contests.

Each dormitory prided itself on its traits and accommodations. The dormitories were as follows:

Quanata Loft sported the wittiest, cleverest, and most imaginative students at the school. Those with the passions of learning and self-expression tended to make their way here in the cozy attic loft reaching towards the heavens. Their tastes were eclectic, as was the decor. Students with big dreams, new ideas, natural philosophers and those with an artistic eye made the loft a certainly eccentric place.

Wrocklehurst Cellar was an ancillary building in the Citadel with erstwhile students. Ones that made plenty of effort and didn’t take much credit for their efforts. Yet while none of the resident mages were stupid, there was the constant impression that ‘problem’ students ended up in the cellar. The reasons varied, from poor performance in one class, physical handicaps, or esoteric living arrangements needed as a result from obscure parentage. Wrocklehurst Cellar strived to make all welcome and had decidedly rustic architecture.

Meldelvian Dungeon had a gothic and sometimes sinister reputation. Those with interests in the macabre side of magic and a killer fashion sense crowded the gloom of the darkest dungeons. Many cultivated a frightening personality to make an impression. Few were inherently evil in this dormitory, although the stereotype of being the strange and scary kids did little to foster a positive image.

Vinixivue Tower championed have the best of the best. The most elite, the boldest, bravest and rising stars in the next generation of the magical world. The tower was one of the more imposing in the citadel, clade with opulence that spoke of past celebrities. It was a big name dormitory at the school, popular and prone to partying. Perhaps with a devil may care attitude, as many students of the dorm felt they could do no wrong.

Kunok Quarters, unlike many of the other dormitories, did not boast over having better accommodations or better students. The dorms were practical, simple and functional above all, never letting flash and panache get in the way of school life. Kunok students tended to be self disciplined and very loyal neighbors, drawing accolades from their collective efforts rather than a number of individual standouts. You were never without a friend or assistance at Kunok, or so it was said. As welcoming as they were Kunok was not the dorm to cross, as they could be as hard and resolute with a grudge as the stones of their corridors.


Although students tended to be associated with their dormitory for the rest of their life at the Citadel, the school also encouraged dormitory exchange. The upperclassmen were able to live in a different dormitory for the year. This helped broaden horizons and also brought new perspectives to the next generation of magic folk.

As Phineas Fortescue collected his luggage, he contemplated what the results of his dormitory exchange would be. He had been in Kunok Quarters since his first year at the Citadel. Unlike most of the dormitory he tended to keep to himself, staying out of the limelight. Phineas wasn't too sure about entering dormitory rotation. His family had suggested it, they thought it might help foster some ambition in him with a new outlook. Unlike his family's hopes, Phineas had a more dour outlook. Moving into a new dormitory would be such a change, he wasn't sure it would be for him.

Just where was Phineas Fortescue going to room this year?
13.title: Dormitory Rotation

choices: There's always something to eat at the feast.
Taking in the demos and performances of the pavilion tents.
Phineas unexpectedly becomes privy to some illicit activities.
He stumbles into a situation he would rather not be in.
The festival passes as a blur. The morning after, however, is more complicated.
14.content:
There was no crazier time at the Citadel Preparatory Academy for Rite & Sorcery than the Welcoming Festival. It introduced students to the wonders of life at the ancient magical fortress. In many ways it was the last chance for fun before the serious approach to studies was enforced by the teaching staff.

All in all the Welcoming Festival was quite compact. It lasted from the time students arrived on the locomotive to an official cutoff point of about 10 pm (22 hrs) although several students had their own ideas for festivities that could easily last until midnight.

The Citadel did not disappoint during a party. There was a grand feast, the first big meal of the year. There were numerous displays and marvels, from swarms of trained bats to choirs of nymphs, performing ghosts, dancing skeletons and other such supernatural entourages. In the center pavilion there would be tents with demonstrations as to the varied courses in magic the Citadel offered. Student leaders also had booths for various student organizations and clubs. New students were typically lead into icebreaker games at whichever of the five dormitories they had been assigned. The festivities were closed off by a spectacular fireworks show at 22 hrs.

Although the more rambunctious students had their own plans for the Welcoming Festival, activities that were never effectively quashed. Smuggling in booze was quite common, the magical world having several strange and potent brews. Those longing in their freedoms would sneak into unauthorized areas or plan elaborate pranks against a disliked teacher or student. Some would try to find a private area for impromptu make out sessions.

All Phineas Fortescue knew was that the Welcoming Festival was loud. It wasn't a celebration one could sit out (he'd tried before) as the noise and atmosphere from the event permeated the whole Citadel. Anyone hoping for a slow progression into academy life or someone as introverted as Phineas wasn't going to find much of interest in the various distractions of the Welcoming Festival. At its worst, all the hullabaloo was just annoying to experience.

Going into his penultimate year at the Citadel, however, Phineas had finally settled on the notion of not trying to fight the festivities. True, the Welcoming Festival was not his cup of tea but this was one of his last festivals. Perhaps this outlook was a sign that Phineas was finally coming out of his shell.

So what does Phineas try next?
14.title: The Welcoming Festival

choices: Play it cool, Phineas, and your wildest dreams will remain true.
Deflect the question while trying to tease out details of last night.
Bolt for the door!
Hell hath no fury like four witches that catch you in a lie.
145.content:
Phineas slowly felt his mind stir. His eyes were closed as he was splayed out on the bed. It was a comfortable, cozy feeling, rising out of sleep without a care in the world. His dreams were a slurry that he couldn't decipher with a half awake mind but something had felt good about them. He shifted, his arms reaching out into the cushions. The surface was warm and fleshy under the cloth, jiggling from his touch, and he gave it a squeeze.

"Mhmmm..." a pleasurable moan came from the other occupant of the bed.

Adrenaline jolted Phineas awake as his eyes shot open.

This wasn't his room. This wasn't his bed! He tilted his head furtively, looking from side to side. Under the sheets two massive forms sandwiched him in the middle of the bed. He heard snoring. To his right was the rising stomach of a rather fat girl. Phineas was stunned, feeling himself grow hot and it wasn't from the covers. He'd dreamed about putting forward the effort to talk to one of the fat, weighty women of his affections and here he was, impossibly waking beside one. He had to pinch himself to see if he was still dreaming.

Another low moan of ecstasy escaped from his left side bedmate. He had forgotten where his hand had strayed.

Phineas was waking up in bed next to two fat beauties!

"Morning'," came the purr from his left. Phineas was face to face with a round, freckled face framed by auburn hair and adorned with sparkling green eyes. A girl about his age smiled at him, peeling herself free from the bedsheets.

The shock in face continued as Phineas found his eyes looking down the length of her horizontal body. While her face was round not too much of her was out of proportion...until he saw her wide, fat thighs spilling out of her white nightdress, each thigh as thick as his waist. They were as freckled as her face.

She grinned, revealing a slight gap in her teeth. "Gosh, you look more frightened than pixie about to be eaten by a bugbear."

"Uh-h-h-h..."

Suddenly, even though this was exactly where Phineas wanted to be he felt very uncomfortable. He backed up, wanting to put more appropriate distance between him and the thick thighed godiva in the bed, forgetting about the other occupant that had him trapped on the mattress.

The large bellied behemoth snorted awake. "Huh? That you Siv?"

"No silly," said the freckled, leg heavy girl Phineas had squeezed in his sleep, presumably Siv. "It's our new friend, Maeve, he's all flustered."

"The cutie?" Maeve turned over, catching Phineas off guard. Maeve had big lips, blue eyes and a small mole just off her chin, framed by sandy brown hair. She probably had fifty or so pounds on Siv, mostly resting in her middle. "You're still here! Last night was so much fun."

"L-Last N-Night??"

Phineas had completely blacked out about last night. He recalled getting off the train upon arrival at the Citadel. The welcoming festivities had been underway...but he couldn't remember anything else. What was he doing in a bed shared by two other, if very attractive, weighty girls? Suddenly Phineas realized himself, finding that he thankfully had slept in his uniform but it was in disarray.

"Come here," Maeve continued, rolling over with an arm outstretched to hug Phineas.

Whatever destiny had gotten Phineas into this situation failed him now that he was back to his senses as he tried to scramble back, hoisting himself upright.

"Don't crush him, Maeve," Siv chided, "you're scaring him."

"I'm t-terribly sorry," Phineas tried to begin, mind racing as he tried to make sense of the whole affair. Caught off balance, both mentally and physically, he felt himself teeter as he tried to step over Siv and found himself instead falling over her and off the bed, the floor rushing up to meet him.

At least the landing was soft. Not only from the carpet, as Phineas had landed face first into a perfectly pliable, peach shaped bum of someone passed out on the floor.

Three?!

"I'm up!" came a singsongy voice that soon faltered. "Ooo dear, I've had too much to drink."

Phineas scrambled up. The broad, lovely shaped bum shifted to reveal the blonde that blinked his direction. "Who are you again?"

Siv giggled from the bed, before helping Phineas sit up with a pair of strong yet soft hands. "Calliope, honestly, you were the first to meet him!"

"Ooh ho ho~," Calliope turned, leaning in far too close as Phineas realized she was half dressed in the Citadel's uniform and a pair of pale yellow tights. Her skin was bronze and her teeth gleaming white. Her voice carried that musical quality again. "The Phinery, right? Phin-phin."

"Phin-phin?" Phineas mouthed, worriedly.

"Siv, you've had too much time to cuddle with him," the hefty Maeve complained, dressed in a red bathrobe now that she emerged from the sheets.

"Cuddle?" Phineas felt the blood drain from his face as every impossible fantasy he'd had in his years of coming to this school went off in his head.

He couldn't help it that the draining blood decided to enter a certain other body part.

"Oh my," Calliope, the bottom heavy blonde, put a hand to her lips as she looked down. Phineas followed suit and quickly flung his hands to cover his arousal.

There was a knock at the bedroom door. "Ladies, aren't you up yet? Gods, I had way too much to eat last night."

A fourth girl entered the room. She had long black hair trailing down her back and sultry, heavily makeup'd eyes. Unlike the rest she was dressed but not in the school uniform. Her blouse was loose and her slacks unbuttoned for good reason. Her hands cradled a burgeoning potbelly from her otherwise slender frame. "I can't go to classes looking like..." She caught sight of Phineas, staring.

"Gird?" Said Siv, the playfulness in her voice dropping into concern. "Oh no, class! I have a full morning of druid rituals!" The freckled, thick-thighed honey jumped out of bed.

"Boo!" said Maeve, as her stomach rumbled. "Please tell me the morning back breakfast will be as good as the feast."

"I'm due back for my apprenticeship," said Calliope, groaning, "but last night was so much fun."

Gird, the black haired newcomer, stifled a belch. "Gotta admit, Fortescue, I always thought you were too much of a dud." She flashed him a brief smile before turning serious. "But I think it's best if you don't say anything more about what all happened yesterday.

"Uh, sure," Phineas said. What in the hells had happened yesterday? He couldn't have loose lips about events he couldn't personally remember.

In the midst of the three large ladies and the potbelly vixen getting themselves ready for the first lessons back at the Citadel, Siv paused as she looked at Phineas's bewildered confusion. "Wait. Do you not remember what happened last night?"

Phineas froze.
145.title: Bewildering Waking

choices: Maeve, the hearty massive cleric.
Siv, the romantic thunder-thighed druid
Callipoe, the bubble-headed bottom-heavy bard.
Gird, the skinny but pot-bellied summoner.
Another wrinkle from last night, as a different girl recognizes Phineas.
1452.content:
At Siv's question, all four of the girls stared directly at Phineas. This unbelievable dream would turn into a nightmare if Phineas admitted he couldn't really remember how he had wound up sharing a bed with two of them.

"Last night?" Phineas replied, thinking fast. "Of course. Well, mostly, I've got a bit of a headache actually."

"You poor thing," Siv said, feeling his forehead, as Phineas stared into her eyes to avoid looking down at the heft of her thighs as she knelt beside him. "The drinks were my and Gird's idea, I'm sure we're all a little hungover."

"The drinks, yeah," Phineas caught on, "I'm honestly not much of a drinker." Truthfully, Phineas had never had more than the occasional wine if at a fancy meal, he had never fancied the taste of alcohol.

"You're all weak-livered!" Maeve chuckled, heaving herself up from the bed. "Still, not unexpected when you decide to cross mugs with a cleric of the Divine Harvester."

Divine Harvester? Phineas wasn't as versed on his religions, although several divine domains had their respective temples about the Citadel for the purposes of instructing their followers. He remembered there was a goddess of food and drink but the name escaped him.

"And to think that prank of yours almost backfired," Calliope said. "Has anyone seen my flute?"

"Prank?" a new mystery caught Phineas off guard.

"Here," Gird said, waving her hand as a magical portal briefly appeared in the air as a silvery flute passed out of it, as she handed it to Calliope.

"Thanks," Calliope smiled. "Although I'm glad to have met you, Phinny, you've got a raw but lovely tenor voice that could do with some training."

"Th-thanks," Phineas said. He had been singing, too?? Phineas could understand music theory well enough, he had never fostered the talent.

"Although sneaking up to the south tower roof was a better spot to view the fireworks from," Siv said.

"Alright girls, enough chit-chat," Gird said. With a clap of her hands a crackle of eldritch fire appeared above them, with a winged impish quasit appearing in the flames. "Ready my Enchanting Workbench," she instructed, and the quasit disappeared. She prodded her stomach. "This belly is a little more problematic, do we have any bloat-away potion?"

"There might be some in the bathroom," Calliope said. "Gosh, I have to tune my lute today too."

Maeve heaved a heavy sigh. "And there's morning rituals for me."

That's right, today was the first day of classes at the Citadel. Phineas felt almost forgotten as the girls hurried about the business. "So, the four of you are roommates, right?"

"Of course," Siv said, opening the window. With a soft gesture she encouraged the vines outside on the castle walls to blossom into small flowers.

"It's just, uh, surprising I guess given your various magical aptitudes." Through observation and brief explanation, Phineas learned that the four students focused on the clerical, druidic, bardic and summoning branches of magic. That is to say, Maeve channeled her faith with her goddess into divine miracles; Siv was greatly attuned to the natural world with reverence; Calliope practiced how magic was much like music, it had patterns and improvisation; and Gird focused on the aspects of reality, summoning verges and aid from other realms of magic.

"What's your expertise, Phinny?" Calliope asked.

"Nothing in particular, I guess I'm more scholarly," he admitted.

"Really? Well, maybe we can meet up for some study groups, I'm quite lousy on my history--" Calliope trailed off, the situation dawning on her. "Wait, you're still here!"

"Yeah," and then the same concern dawned on Phineas. "It's been great meeting you all, but how do I get out of here unnoticed?"

The four student witches paused. "We didn't actually think of that," Maeve said.

"Actually, where are we?" Phineas asked.

"This is Kunok Quarters," Siv said.

Phineas let out a whistle. "*phew*, that simplifies matters I guess. I belong in the boys' dorms."

Several ideas for how to help Phineas leave unnoticed came up, from having him crawl along the window ledge, turn him invisible, turn him into a frog or such to smuggle him out, use a broom, all ideas quickly shot down as they grew more and more ludicrous.

"How good are you with tight spaces," Gird asked.

"I'm not claustrophobic, if that's what you're asking," Phineas said.

"Come with me, you have to promise me you won't say anything about this," Gird said.

"And promise you'll stay in touch with us!" Maeve said. Phineas had managed to skate out of there with his neck intact, fancied by each of the girls as much as he was intrigued by them, yet still horribly confused as to how he got into this situation.

Gird led him into the girl's shared living room, crossing to a curtained closet. "I've got a traveling trunk," she said, parting the curtain to reveal a large box chest. "It's how we've been sneaking things inside the Citadel."

"Ah, right," Phineas mouthed."

"I've got another one that's still housed in receiving luggage by the gatehouse," Gird explained, "so that gets you outside the doors where you'll draw less attention. That sound okay."

"Sure, um, thanks again," Phineas said. Compared to how he felt this morning, lying down in a magical trunk was the least awkward and unusual.

"It's perfectly harmless," Gird said before she shut him in, giving Phineas a wink. "Catch you later sometime, alright?"

"Yeah," Phineas said. The lid closed and he was plunged into momentary darkness, enough to hear Gird call out "Can I borrow a corset--" before he was transported into a different trunk interior.

Phineas cracked open the lid, finding this trunked wedged onto a shelve with several other pieces of luggage, but with enough room for him to squeeze out. The ploy had worked. As he snuck his way out of the gatehouse, Phineas tried to make sense of all that must have happened during the Welcoming Feast. This was a far different start to the year compared to his previous years of magic schooling.


Ultimately, Phineas could only piece out some of the details of what had transpired during the night of the welcoming feast. Maybe if he got closer to one of the girls, he could get a more direct account. Each of the roommates were rather nice, and had helped him sneak out of their dorm without notice.

So where there was a break after classes, Phineas went to see...
1452.title: Much Ado About Nothing Last Night

choices: Forget the master, it's the co-ed partner apprentice that catches Phineas's eye.
Phineas is apprenticed to a teacher that has somehow discovered his secret.
He is apprenticed to a strange magical being...
...or alternatively, an entity from another plane contacted in esoteric ways.
Phineas tries to back out of being an apprentice, but it's impossible to undo.
15.content:
The moment Phineas Fortescue had stepped off the locomotive at the Citadel's train station, he heard his name being called for over the bustle of the crowd.

"Urgent message for Phineas Fortescue! Urg-ent message for Phineas Fortescue!"

"Th-that's me," Phineas waved down the Citadel messenger. He was promptly given a rolled up parchment by the strange little imp who immediately began calling out another message. Phineas no longer paid attention to the imp's cry. He held the parchment nervously, unsure about opening it. He couldn't recall having done anything to get himself in trouble with the school authorities. If there had been a previous need for correspondence he would have received it at home over the summer.

Balking at the rolled up message wasn't going to get Phineas anywhere. Hesitantly, he unfurled the message and began reading:

"Dear Mr. Phineas Fortescue,
The Citadel Academy for Rites & Sorcery is pleased to inform you that your scholarship has been selected for advancement into apprentice studies. You are check in at administration for any changes in accommodations, and then report to your--"


Phineas took big gulps of air in surprise, going back to reread over the first few sentences again. He'd been made an apprentice?!

The Citadel shepherded students through eight years of magical education, with Phineas entering his penultimate or second to last. That was the majority of the student population. However, the Citadel also had its own version of graduate level coursework or apprenticeships to some of the most powerful wizards, witches, warlocks and other magical beings that taught at the school. Becoming an apprentice was an arduous, grueling task. Many students fancied themselves as being capable young magicians yet numerous failed to make the cut to work under the scrutinizing masters.

"There must be some sort of mistake," Phineas said to himself. Becoming an apprentice had sounded like so much work he had never considered it. Each master or mistress focused their apprentices on a specific niche of magic, studies that could extend life at the Citadel anywhere from an average of two to four years. That's if any of them survived. It was a rare but gruesome truth that in the past apprentices had gotten themselves killed from magical accidents or challenges they were not yet prepared for, amongst other dangers with learning such advanced magic directly from a master.

Phineas had certainly never signed himself up for it. Apprentices were commonly contacted during the summer and he had just received this message after getting off the train. Yet here the message was on official Citadel parchment. The fact that he was now an apprentice worried Phineas, as the risk far outweighed the positives in his mind. Apprentices were regarded with awe by the lesser study body, with access to privileges most at the Citadel didn't even know existed. It all depended on your master or mistress, each selective educator having their own quirks and reputation.

Cripes! Phineas hadn't finished reading the message yet. He still didn't know whomever he was pressed into apprenticeship for...
15.title: Phineas The Apprentice

choices: Bella Lovejoy
Gladia Storm
Misty Lune
151.content:
Phineas scanned the note one more time, but the only other real useful piece of information on it was the name of his Master - Janus Dao. Of course, that set off another wave of disbelief in Phineas's mind. Professor Dao was one of the foremost sorcerers in the world today, a wizard who focused his studies on the dualities inherent in many magical traditions. Fire & water, light & dark, life & death - Professor Janus had made many discoveries in how they interacted with each other. It was a great honor to be selected as his apprentice.

Of course Janus Dao, like many powerful magicians, had his own eccentricities. In Dao's case, it was an obsession with the number two. He always trained two apprentices when he took them on, and they either passed together or failed together. Which meant that if he screwed up now, it wouldn't only be his ass on the line anymore. Another student's future would now ride on how well Phineas did as an apprentice to one of the most renowned mages in the world. Phineas groaned as he felt his stress continue to build.

As he made his way towards the accommodations office, Phineas saw several other students moving along with him. All of them had been chosen by other powerful wizards to be their apprentices. All except one, who would be Phineas's parter. Phineas wondered who it might be. As his eyes roved over his classmates, three in particular caught his attention.

The first was Bella Lovejoy. She was one of the most popular girls in his year, because she was both incredibly smart and incredibly generous. She had helped many of her classmates who were struggling with their coursework without a second thought. In fact, Phineas was fairly sure he would have failed Intermediary Elementalism without her aid. She was also rather pretty, with blonde hair and blue eyes. Best of all, in Phineas's opinion, was her softness. Bella was known for having a sweet tooth, and many students had repaid her help by giving her candies and pastries. Phineas himself had gone ahead and gotten her an entire pie when she'd helped him, and to his surprise had eaten it all in front of him. Naturally, her hips had been getting wider as time went on. Yes, having Bella Lovejoy as a partner would be rather nice.

There was also Gladia Storm, who was widely considered to be the smartest girl in his year. She had consistently earned top marks in all of her classes, and excelled at any task she set her mind to. As one might expect, she was very competitive and abrasive, which explained why she was not as popular as Bella was. Gladia occasionally shot a dark look at the blonde, and Phineas knew she considered Bella one of her biggest academic rivals. What might happen if she turned that intensity on him? Phineas shuddered as he remembered how intense she could be when she competed with anyone. Her black hair, grey eyes, and lithe figure were considered attractive to many, but not to him. Yes, Phineas would rather not be paired with Gladia Storm.

The last of the others to catch his attention was Misty Lune. Misty was, in one word, a tease. She enjoyed joking and flirting with everyone around her, which made her the life of the party. She was never too mean-spirited about it, though, which was why she still as popular as she was. That and the fact that Misty Lune was widely considered to have one of the best pair of breasts on campus. Even Phineas, who preferred his woman with thicker waists than Misty had, could appreciate them. Misty's white hair and pale skin, products of her albinism, also gave her a mysterious air. Being partnered with Misty Lune could be interesting.

Finally, Phineas and the rest arrived in the accommodations office, which was already full. Not with other wizards, but with various animals, demons, and spirits. Familiars, Phineas realized, contracted servants of their new masters. Each of the assembled familiars had signs floating by them with names on them. The signs all had names written on them - the familiars would guide the new apprentices to their teachers. After looking around, Phineas finally found his name on a sign that was floating by a two-headed hellhound puppy. There was also another name on that sign:
151.title: The Two Apprentices

choices: To start with, Phineas and Misty must live together to nurse the hellhound.
They work closely with Dao's other paired apprentices with curious dualities.
Misty's allergy to the orthus has acute side-effects.

1513.content:
"Misty Lune?" Phineas read with surprise.

"Ah, Fortescue isn't it?" Misty Lune said. She was dressed smartly for the day of becoming an apprentice, making Phineas feel like he should have dressed up for the occasion, even though he had only just learned of this prestigious opportunity.

Misty wore sleek lavender and midnight purple robes, fitted around her impressive bust. Her milky white skin had a hint of blush from her blood, and she carried herself with an almost airy countenance.

Phineas gulped at the coy greeting. They weren't strangers by any means, although weren't friends either. Phineas and Misty had schooled together for many years, a frequent face in shared classes. There was a brief time, early in their second year when they were very much still children, that Misty had called Phineas her 'beaux' for half a semester. Puppy level crush that had not been one to last, one before Misty became a flirtatious partier and Phineas developed his attraction towards chubbier girls in their grade. Yet some of that old magnetism towards Misty had lingered, as she became quite beautiful with not only her face and charm but her natural figure with a perfect pair of breasts.

The reunion was broken by a trail of slobber spilled on Phineas' shoe from their joint familiar. Misty giggled as he struggled to wipe it off on the floor.

"So, Misty, I must admit I don't quite know why I'm here. Or why we're both in possession of a drooling orthus."

"I think she's cute," Misty said, bending to scratch behind the ears of the other head of the two headed puppy, more receptive to her presence.

"How do you know she's a sh--?" Phineas asked, although stopping himself as he noticed that he had a stunning view of Misty's pale cleavage given the position she took to pet the creature.

"She and he, Mr. Fortescue," spoke the sage tones of their new master, Janus Dao.

Phineas immediately straightened himself, not wanting his first impressions with the permanent sorcerer to be looking lustily at his co-ed fellow apprentice. The whole situation was still surreal to Phineas, although as a budding scholar he knew the honor of having this chance. Janus Dao had long grey hair tied in a bun with two chopsticks, along with an impressive mustache drooping on either side of his mouth towards his chin. His hands were folded in the sleeves of his exquisite robes. Dao's obsession with duality extended to his wardrobe as well, with each half of his robes having a different intricate pattern in contrasting color schemes, with accents of the opposite pattern on each part of the robe. It was a dizzying outfit to look at.

"Orthus are often born with male and female personalities in the same form," Janus Dao explained.

"And they are natural guardians," Misty said, also standing, cradling the two-headed pup close to her chest. "As hellhounds they patrol the barriers to the nether realms, and occasionally other areas of great magical significance."

"Yes, Miss Lune." Janus Dao regarded the both of them. "Together, you and Mr. Fortescue will be helping me research into the great dichotomies. And the balance of masculine and feminine is perfect with your position as my newest pair of apprentices and your familiar's own two sexes."

"Excuse me?" Phineas said with a nervous, small sound that made Misty giggle. Phineas didn't consider himself the strongest, handsome, or bravest and as such not the obvious example of masculinity, short of his gender.

"Do not downplay your accomplishments, Mr. Fortescue," Janus Dao explained. "While others of your year have accolades to their name that you do not, you have shown a consistent intelligence and stellar ethics towards your coursework that is suitably for this level of magical advancement." He turned to Misty. "And Miss Lune has a vitality and exuberance towards life, society and magic that finds enjoyment in all she does. Together I could consider no better pairing given your aptitudes."

Misty smiled and Phineas just grinned, thinking there had to be more to it than that. Yet the crowd of apprentices in the accommodations office shifted, as various academics and their personal pupils settled into arrangements and gathered familiars. Janus Dao spoke briefly as to what life for Phineas and Misty would now mean, as there were many elements of schedule and logistics to work out.

Soon the pair of fresh apprentices were lefty alone. Long enough that Misty dropped her smile and sneezed.

"Are you alright?" Phineas asked.

"Of course, *ACHOO*" Misty rubbed her nose, which only made the sneezing fit worse, as the hellhound pup was thrust into Phineas' hands.

He looked at the two heads of the orthus unsure as to the expression of the brother-sister heads as they were upset at the sudden movement. And then a thought came to him.

"Are you allergenic to orthus?" Phineas asked Misty as she pulled a handkerchief out from under her left breast.

"n-N-no..." she replied after blowing her nose, although Phineas could see that her eyes had watered.

If Phineas had to guess, maybe Misty was as ill-prepared for this apprenticeship with Janus Dao as he was feeling. Only that was just the beginning, as Phineas and Misty soon learned the full terms of this apprenticeship.
1513.title: A Pair and a Pup

choices: Hellhound rearing continues to leave Misty puffy and bloated.
By the date of their trials, the hellhound isn't the only one to have grown.
Misty's allergies are too much, as Phineas finds some help with the orthus.
15133.content:
In two weeks time, Phineas Fortescue and Misty Lune would begin their biggest trial under their master, Janus Dao. The grandmasters of the Citadel had their own number of apprentices and their own methods of training them. Given his obsession with dualities and the number two, Dao trained pairs of apprentices and as such had one of the larger rosters of personal students, yet there was very little interaction given the specific polarities each set of partners were studying. His other pair of newcomers this year were a pair of witches, one bubbly and one morose, furthering his research into light and dark magicks while it was rumored that an older pair of apprentices, ones mastering the elements of fire and water, couldn't get along and were very close to failing if they didn't shape up this year.

Phineas still wasn't quite sure what he and Misty would be doing in master Janus Dao's lessons. He had paired them specially as male and female, down to a sister-brother two headed hellhound (with the female as the right head of the orthus, the male as the left head). And while this brought Phineas into close proximity with the opposite sex, one he knew and found rather attractive in personality and physique, the implications troubled his indecisive, hormone addled and introspective tendencies.

"Have you thought of names yet," Misty asked him.

"Huh?" Phineas snapped out of his thoughts. He and Misty had met up during a nursing session for the hellhound, until their final living arrangements as apprentices were finalized.

"Names for our dear familiar when we present them to master Dao," Misty giggled. "You're such a scatterbrain, Fortescue."

"Oh, right." It was bit perplexing for him to think of their shared familiar as two personalities in the same body, a bit of article confusion that he would have to get used to. "I'm not too sure with two names."

"We could always go with the classics," Misty said as she stooped down with two bottles of formula, Phineas begrudgingly trying to keep the heads apart so they could be properly fed. "There's Artemis and Apollo," she suggested.

"The twin gods, yeah, url--" Phineas had to move his hand quickly before it got bit by the male head. "I had thought of Artemis as both males and females have had the name, but if we need two for the orthus..."

"Or there's Eros and Psyche, if you'd prefer."

"Isn't that the god of sex and--" Phineas felt his face grow crimson. In Greek Mythology Eros and Psyche had been the most notable lovers. Misty's eyes were level with his, jittering a bit slightly due to her albinism, but full of mirth and a spark of amusement at making Phineas so uncomfortable.

And then the moment ended suddenly as Misty stood up to sneeze.

Phineas was left scrambling to keep the bottles of formula at each head of the hellhound. "A-Are you alright, Misty?"

"Oh, I'll be alright," she said with a stuffed noised, teary eyed, as she fished for her handkerchief from her bosom again to dry at her eyes and clear her sinuses. Despite the sudden jolt of her sneeze Phineas had witness her perk breasts bounce majestically from the motion, and image he would keep in mind when alone.

"But if you're allergic, how exactly are we going to make this work out?"

Misty's eyes, usually somewhat colorless, were growing red from the sinus aggravation. "We never did keep pets at home after my parents once got me a puppy. It was its fine fur, you see, it causes irritation and puffiness."

Now that his attention was brought to it, Phineas could see that Misty was looking puffy. Her cheeks were a smidge wider, hinting that hers would be an aptly named moonface if she ever put on weight above her bust line. Her arms and fingers also looked a bit puffy, and maybe he was imagining it but her clothes looked a little ill fitting.

"Like swelling?" Phineas suggested.

"Somewhat," Misty said. "I'm generally better with dogs once they've grown older, less shedding." She blew her nose. "Orthus grow up fast but in all honesty I may have to ask you to handle more of the nursing *AAACHOO!*"

"We'll sort it out, don't worry," Phineas replied, mind already racing with responsibilities and possibilities. "Things will shape up before we enter our trials with Master Dao. In fact, do we have more formula?"

Passing to a sink to wash her handkerchief, Misty said, "Yes...why?"

After the two heads were fed, Phineas got up to root around the medicines in the cabinet in their stall where young familiars were kept. "Well, whenever me or my brothers and sisters would get a cold, mum would usually put our medicine in milk. The only home remedy I know, really."

"At this point I'm willing to try anything," Misty said, "I suppose this is close enough."

A strong dose of allergy medicine was added to the nutrient rich, milky formula the pair of fresh apprentices were using as Phineas gave the glass to Misty. "Bottoms up, as they say," she replied, thanking Phineas.

Seeing the milky skinned, white haired Misty Lune drink the medicine through the thick formulae, Phineas was hit with a spark of inspiration. "What if we went Persian on names? Like Zaal and Rudabeh?"

"From the epic of Shahnameh?" Misty mused. "Hmm, I'm not against it. The source names are contrary to our own complexions, wouldn't you say."

"It would be our own twist on it, ah," Phineas found himself losing his voice, unable to vocalize to Misty that she had a drip of formula running from her lips to the prestigious swell of her right breast.

153.content:
You future patron will contact you after your report to the 5th sanctum

Patron? The 5th Sanctum? Warning bells were sounding off in Phineas' head. This was worse than being thrust into an apprenticeship without advance notice. But Phineas was tasked to apprentice to a new patron?

There were many spheres of magic, and innate magical power sufficed most through their lives as witches and wizards at both the Citadel and the rest of their lives. But Warlocks were of note as well. It wasn't forbidden knowledge, rather an uncommon occurrence, where magic practitioners made pacts with magical entities for more power. One could argue that eh acolytes of the holy, divine 'gods' who altered their magic through devotion and worship was the more acceptable practice.

But Phineas had been sent to report at the 5th Sanctum, a justly named five times warded bastion where both professors and students at this level contacted the strangest realms known to magic. Areas that, with one wrong incantation or lack of fortitude, might spell the doom of the entire Citadel let alone the world!

And how had Phineas been made an apprentice in this way? Surely this must be some sort of mistake! Once Phineas had arrived at the cloistered entrance to the 5th Sanctum, he told the proctor in charge of admittance that they must have the wrong student.

"Fortescue, Phineas," the proctor read from a scroll. "No, you have indeed been summoned. Requested, in fact."

Phineas gulped. "Requested? By whom, what?"

The proctor just stared at him. "Discretion is of upmost importance with the 5th Sanctum. You will be protected during your contact within these walls, but we can no more explain to you the aspects of your patron better than they can explain it."

Phineas felt his stomach turn into a knot. This did not sound like it was in his skillset at all! This was a task for a different Fortescue!

"Come this way." The proctor led Phineas past an unsealed vault door into the 5th Sanctum. Low light glowed from flameless candles set in sconces along the strong, heavy pillars in the Sanctum, the very foundations of the greater Citadel in some respects. He was told to stand in the center of a large, warded circle.

Phineas could identify the glyphs along the circle for the most part, noticing ones of protection, summoning, and transportation but unable to discern the target realm this circle contacted. Overwhelmed, Phineas tried to protest but he was too late, the runes of the circle glowed brightly and Phineas found his consciousness shifted.

----

"Welcome, young Phineas! I shall be your new teacher!"

Whatever Phineas could have possibly thought of, whatever he had feared, absolute nothing could have prepared Phineas for what he found within the magic circle.

Especially not a classroom. Rather, the simple furniture of a classroom. A student's desk, a professor's desk, a blackboard.

And that was before he could fully comprehend the razor-toothed, golden eyed, fuzzy black demon lady looking back at him.

"...teacher?" was all Phineas could mouth.

He was doubly surprised that this response appeared to catch the demon off guard as well. "Is it too much? The graduation robes, the mortarboard? Definitely the latter, I knew I didn't have the horns to pull it off."

Horns was the understatement of the year as said by this husky voiced, feminine demon, as she looked to have a pair of antlers! The tassel of the mortarboard got caught as she tried to extract it from her head.

"Oh, close your mouth kid, I wasn't trying to scare you or anything. Think of our future prospects like any other of your classes. Only with a vastly different commute."

Politeness and sincerity is not what Phineas expected to experience when talking to a demon, let alone so casual of conversation. "I'm sorry, wait, what is going on here? Why do you want to teach me?"

"Have a seat, Phin. That cool for a nickname? 'Forts' sounds way too dorky," the antlered demon turned to hang up her robes on a coat rack made of bone spurs Phineas hadn't seen earlier.

As Phineas took the offered seat at the student's desk, he got a full look at his patron. A real full look.

"I like keeping things as casual as possible, Phin, so don't worry your mind all that much about the infernal magicks at work." Instead of taking her chair behind the desk, this demonic patron sat on the deck. Although she could have passed for remaining unclothed given the thick, scratchy black fur along most of her body, she was tightly squeezed into a vest that gave shape to her curves. Plump chested and tremendously hip heavy. Phineas found himself starring at how each mammoth cheek of her weighty but and thighs overhung the corner of ornate professor's desk.

The demon caught him staring. "Mm, my form is pleasurable to you?"

Phineas was both horribly ashamed and aroused at the same time, trying to gather his thoughts. "Are you--some sort of succubus?"

"Am I a succubus?" the demon lady laughed, a mirthful jiggle in her lower regions. "Oh, that's a good one Phin kid. You're too kind, no really."

"I--huh?" Phineas, in the entirety of his magical education at the Citadel, had never expected his life would take a turn like this.

"Let me cut straight to the chase, kid. I need someone of your predilections to get me out of a jam. That which inflames your passions; The allure of a weighty female."

Phineas coughed. THAT's what this mysterious apprenticeship was about??!

"Desperate times call for desperate measures," the demonic patron said, introducing herself. "My name is Hesbeth. Although you can call me Beth, probably won't raise as many flags if you refer to me as such in the mortal realm. Co-Sloth and Gluttony demon."

"Hes-err, Beth?" Phineas was confused. The demon's name was Beth? "Co-Sloth and Gluttony demon?"

"I'm going to let you in on a little secret, Phin kid. You know of the demonic hells, places of internal punishment and booming figures of pain, hate, and monstrous appearances? That's us overplaying it, making a show out of the lower reaches. The demonic hells have become far more bureaucratic as of late. And the flow of demonic power comes down to a simple equation. We encourage sin to be spread throughout the world to gain power from the acts of sin in others. More sin, more power, capiche?"

"I, think I understand," Phineas said.

"But there's been some, restructuring," Hesbeth or Beth continued, "us demons used to have to worry only about one category of sins. Too much overhead, it turned out, and a lot of departments were culled. So although I stated out as a demon of Sloth, I got into the Gluttony gig as well after several jobs with that sin. Which is where you come in, my new and only student."

"Me?"

"It's simple, Phin kid. I need you to advance the cause of Sloth and Gluttony. I'm sure that latter one is right up your alley. That increased sin will get me more power, and more influence for your future lessons. Its a deal we can all benefit from."

Phineas had to be sure he was hearing this right. A glowing eyed, antlered, bottom-heavy fuzzy demon wanted him as a student to further the sins of Sloth and Gluttony?

"You get to live out your fantasies and I'll teach you magic no one has dreamed of yet. That is a pretty sweet deal, kid."

"Isn't there a catch?" It was said to be weary dealing with demons, as they always had ulterior motives. As much as the full explanation somewhat excited Phineas, he was ever a cautious one.

"No catch," Hesbeth said. "Well, not one that's easily explained from your side of the equation. Think of it more as forging new ground. As long as you magic folk have contacted demons, its been a even heavier workload trying to damn your souls along with that of the magic-less populace. I'm willing to bet there's a more lucrative avenue of sin to be had if I have a student, a partner on the other side to advance the cause more subtlety than the next 'Demonic Dark Lord' that gets his ass handed to him by a bunch of heroic champions."

As much as Hesbeth was downplaying this arrangement, Phineas couldn't help but think of the complications. Yet, for once in his life Phineas felt that his attraction wasn't something to be embarrassed by. If he looked at it like any other apprenticeship prospect, his 'predilections' as described by this patron had made him as viable a candidate no different than needing high marks in dueling or runes, for example.

After a long pause of weighing his options, Phineas gave in. "Alright, I'm in."

"Perfect!" Hesbeth lumbered off her desk. "I could squeeze you right now, kid, but its only our first meeting."

"Squeeze?"

"Sorry, hug. That's what you heart-havers call it, right?"

"Heart-havers?"

"Now we're just getting distracted," Hesbeth said, scratching behind one of her antler-horns. "The Citadel where you school isn't aware of what our arrangement actually entails, so you need to keep it on the down low. Start looking for people with sins that need attention. Areas where a hint of Sloth and a pinch of Gluttony can take hold. Make friends."

"I guess I can do that, although what do you mean by future lessons?"

"That'll be scheduled in future, once you've opened some avenues, Phin kid. Remember to keep this on the hush."

"Ok, Professor, umm, Hesbeth."

"Beth, kid," Beth corrected. "Draws less attention my way."

"Sorry, Beth," Phineas said, as the sudden lurch of magic brought him back into the 5th Sanctum under the Citadel, his demonic patron having disappeared.

Being back at the familiar Citadel was a little disorientating, although now Phineas had been entrusted with a special mission, one that played to his desires. His life was about to change.

info.description:
The following is a weight gain and expansion related story set at the Citadel Preparatory Academy for Rites and Sorcery. The Citadel is a mysterious fortress set away from the rest of the world where the extensive study of magic occurs for the next generations of witches, wizards and warlocks. At this preeminent magic school we have our teenage protagonist Phineas Fortescue, an otherwise unremarkable young magician about to enter his penultimate year in magic studies.

Phineas has been a lifelong closeted fat admirer thus far into his magical education. The story enters his life as his private fantasies become realized, as he could potentially meet the weighty love of his life. Several weighty loves, actually, all vying for his affections. School drama and wayward magic coincides with several romance options with the gaining, overweight and massive females the Citadel has to offer.

Against this tale of love of weight gain, the Citadel is a cosmopolitan magic academy where just about anything is possible. Inspirations include not only Hogwarts from the Harry Potter series but also Unseen University from the Discworld series and the magic of Dungeons & Dragons, amongst other inspirations.

Before we begin, a few guidelines:

Central Character: Phineas' life as a fat admirer and expansion enthusiast is a cornerstone of the story. Should the focus of a storyline drift away from having Phineas as a main character, his presence should still remain central to the plot.

Feminine Weight Gain: Although the Citadel is a co-ed magical education facility, the other main emphasis of the story is on female weight gain. This is not to sale fat males are non-existent or male gain is forbidden, but it would only be allowed from a mutual gaining scenario.

Restrain Magic: Magic is an important part of the series, allowing many magical, supernatural or occult means of weight gain and expansion. While magic follows deliberate patterns and paradoxically still cannot be fully explained, as exceptions to the 'rules' always exist, magic should not be leaned on as the easy solution. It takes a lot of magical power to trigger spectacular events, so refrain from massive instantaneous gains and such if there is no significance to the act.

Write Your Best: I encourage you to write your best and be creative. I may pass through chapters to fix typos or add chapter prompt options but I will not overwrite your additions.

However...

Just because this story is harem genre, it is not a free pass for overly explicit entries. In regards to potential girlfriends for Phineas (17 at the start of the story) the youngest any love interest can be is 15.

Please mind the overall rating of the piece, 13+, when crafting your addition.
